thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Friday, 13 Apr 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Italy's Open Fiber signs agreement with banks for 3.5 bln euro funding - sources

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Italy's Open Fiber signs agreement with banks for 3.5 bln euro funding - sources
text:
MILAN, April 13 (Reuters) - Italyâ€™s Open Fiber is set to sign an underwriting agreement with banks for a 3.5 billion euro ($4.3 billion) project finance package to help roll out its fast broadband network, two sources said, confirming a report in Italian daily Il Sole 24 Ore.
Open Fiber, controlled by Italian utility Enel and state lender Cassa Depositi e Prestiti, is holding a board meeting on Friday to approve a new business plan.
The plan comes days after investor CDP bought a stake in Telecom Italia in a move that some say could open the way to Open Fiber being folded into the network of its bigger rival further down the road. ($1 = 0.8109 euros) (Reporting by Stephen Jewkes; editing by Francesca Landini)
